Hiking has always been an important part of my life. I was introduced to it at a young age through weekend hikes with my family, and it later became a regular activity through trail running during cross country. I'm originally from Aliso Viejo, a city in Orange County, California, where I explored countless trails growing up. Since starting college at the University of California, Santa Barbara, Iâ€™ve continued this passion by hiking along the Santa Ynez Mountains and the stunning coastal trails nearby.

Beyond being a hobby, hiking has long been a therapeutic outlet for me. It gives me space to disconnect from the fast pace of daily life and reconnect with the natural world. Thereâ€™s something incredibly calming about the steady rhythm of walking and the stillness of a mountain trail. Whether itâ€™s climbing toward a summit or wandering through a coastal bluff, these moments offer clarity, peace, and perspective.

One of the most valuable aspects of hiking for me is the escape it provides from screens and constant digital noise. In a world that often feels overstimulated and always online, being out on the trail allows me to be fully present. No pings, no updatesâ€”just the sound of my steps and the natural surroundings. Itâ€™s in those quiet, unplugged moments that I often feel most grounded.

This connection to hiking started early, with frequent hikes alongside my family. Some of my fondest memories come from those outingsâ€”sharing stories on the trail or simply enjoying nature in each otherâ€™s company. Even now, hiking continues to be a way for me to reflect, recharge, and feel rooted in the present moment.

### ðŸ—º Hikes Map

```{r set up}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warnng: false
library(tidyverse)
library(leaflet)
library(leaflet.extras)
library(here)
library(janitor)

# read in data from hikes
hikes <- read_csv(here
                  ("data", "hiking_cords.csv"))
```

```{r clean data}
#| echo: false
hikes_clean <- hikes |> 
  clean_names()
```

```{r icon}
#| echo: false
hikes_icon <- makeIcon(
  iconUrl = here::here("media", "hikes_icon2.png"),
  iconWidth = 20, iconHeight = 20
)
```

```{r making map}
#| echo: false
hikes_map <- leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$Esri.WorldImagery) %>% 
  setView(lng = -118.17, lat = 33.83, zoom = 7) %>%
  addMarkers(data = hikes_clean,
             group = "trail_names",
             icon = hikes_icon,
             lng = ~longitude,
             lat = ~latitude,
             popup = ~paste("Trail Name:", trail_names, "<br>", "Coordinates (lat/long):", latitude, ",", longitude))

hikes_map

```
